channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump signs executive actions to boost US economy amid pandemic
US approaches 5 million cases
'Everything is gone.' Flooding in China ruins farmers and risks rising food prices
Lebanon has always deserved better from its leaders. The port blast lays that bare
item.description: The monstrous explosion that tore into the early evening of a mid-summer's night this past Tuesday in Beirut is, whatever way you cut it, just the latest manifestation of the multitude of endless avenues of miserable corruption that have plagued the country for generations.

item.title: Lebanon protesters storm ministries as violent protests grip Beirut
item.description: Lebanon's Prime Minister Hassan Diab has vowed to hold early elections as his beleaguered government faces calls to resign.

item.title: The 'Lebanese Tiger' on Beirut blast: What you see on TV is nothing compared to reality
item.description: Widely regarded as the greatest ever Asian basketball player, Fadi El Khatib is weeping for Lebanon. The former pro basketball player faces ruin after the port explosion in Beirut on August 4. The father of four has lost his home and business, both shattered and damaged due to the incident.

item.title: Trump's battle with TikTok is so remarkable because it's happening in the 'land of the free'
Mauritius declares a state of environmental emergency over catastrophic oil spill
This New Zealand city has an official wizard
item.description: On a sunny autumn afternoon, two wizards in long, black robes and pointed hats sat down for coffee in one of New Zealand's biggest cities.

item.title: Tutankhamun's last legacy emerges near the pyramids
item.description: For almost a century, King Tutankhamun has been the poster boy for Ancient Egypt. His death mask was sublimely, breathtakingly crafted over 3,300 years ago from 24 pounds of beaten gold, with eyeliner of lapis lazuli and eyes of quartz and obsidian.

item.title: How to fact-check Donald Trump in realtime
item.description: Two recent interviews with President Donald Trump, one on Axios on HBO and another on Fox News Sunday, provide a lesson on how to fact-check the President in realtime. CNN's Daniel Dale breaks it down.

item.title: Brazil passes 100,000 Covid-19 deaths, as cases top 3 million
item.description: Brazil surpassed 100,000 deaths from Covid-19 on Saturday as cases exceeded 3 million, according to the latest numbers by the country's Health Ministry.

item.title: Couple survives Beirut explosion less than 600 meters from blast site
item.description: A couple standing less than 600 meters from the blast site survived the explosion in Beirut - they are now recovering in hospital.

item.title: Esper says US troop levels in Afghanistan to go below 5,000 by end of November
item.description: Defense Secretary Mark Esper said Saturday that the United States will go down to below 5,000 troops in Afghanistan by the end of November.

item.title: 4 children identified among Air India Express plane crash casualties
item.description: • Plane overshoots runway and crashes

item.title: Trump nonsensically accuses Democrats of election 'cheating'
Michelle Obama and Bernie Sanders expected to speak on first night of Democratic convention
item.description: The first night of the Democratic National Convention is currently expected to bring a message of unity featuring Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders, former first lady Michelle Obama and former Republican Ohio Gov. John Kasich, according to a source who has seen current convention plans.

item.title: 6 injured in Philadelphia shooting, police say, including pregnant woman
item.description: Six people were shot in Philadelphia Saturday night, including a pregnant woman, police said.

item.title: The killers of an Indian royal have just been jailed, 35 years after the crime
item.description: On a winter's day in 1985, a one-time Indian prince was killed by police in a bustling Rajasthan market.

item.title: New video shows another Black man in custody pleading, 'I can't breathe,' before his death
item.description: Video that shows a Black man in apparent medical distress repeatedly telling officers, "I can't breathe," days before he died in a hospital was released this week following a North Carolina judge's order.

item.title: Two police officers in Georgia put on leave after shooting at minors
item.description: Two police officers in Georgia are on administrative leave after shooting at five minors during a vehicle stop Saturday morning.

item.title: Why does the US even have a vice president?
item.description: Barack Obama had Joe Biden. Donald Trump has Mike Pence. Joe Biden will have ... somebody!

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Champions League: Inspired Lionel Messi lifts Barcelona into quarterfinals
item.description: Lionel Messi scored a spellbinding goal as Barcelona beat Napoli 3-1 (4-2 on aggregate) in the Camp Nou on Saturday night to advance to the quarterfinals of the Champions League.

item.title: What we can learn from Covid-19 for the climate crisis
item.description: CNN's Bill Weir explores what we can learn from Covid-19 to better prepare for the impact of the climate crisis.

item.title: Brazil's top court backs special protection for indigenous communities
item.description: Brazil's Supreme Court on Wednesday handed a partial victory to the nation's embattled indigenous communities, who are struggling against an insidious new enemy: the Covid-19 virus.

item.title: Joe Arpaio loses Republican primary for sheriff to his former chief deputy
item.description: Joe Arpaio, the former Arizona sheriff known for his controversial hardline tactics against undocumented immigrants, lost his bid to win back his former position in Maricopa County.

item.title: These are the twins whose first-time reaction to hearing Phil Collins has captured the internet
item.description: The almost eight-minute long video begins with Tim Williams and his twin brother, Fred, sitting side by side.

item.title: NASA drops racially insensitive nicknames of celestial bodies
item.description: Grocery store items, pro sports teams, and country music bands have all removed racially insensitive names.

item.title: See large chunk of glacier at risk of falling
item.description: Dozens of people have been evacuated from a valley in northern Italy amid fears that a section of ice the size of a football field could collapse from a glacier.

item.title: US to end deployment of US Marines in Norway after boosting it in 2018 amid Russian tensions
item.description: The US is ending the rotational deployment of some 700 US Marines to Norway, shifting to shorter more periodic deployments and focusing on training with the US Navy, a move that comes days after the Pentagon announced a major draw down of troops in Europe.

item.title: High-speed Cincinnati police chase kills 2 bystanders, hurts 2 more in Kentucky
item.description: Two bystanders were killed Friday and two more injured by a suspect vehicle in a high-speed police chase, Cincinnati Police Chief Eliot Isaac said.

item.title: Suspension dropped for teen who took photo of crowd at school
item.description: The mother of a student who was suspended after posting a photo on Twitter that showed her high school's crowded hallways this week tells CNN that her daughter's suspension has been reversed.

item.title: Inside the federal prison where three out of every four inmates has coronavirus
item.description: When James Giannetta first called his brother Russ in late June to tell him that the coronavirus was beginning to spread in his Texas federal prison, Russ could hear the fear in his voice. "This place is exploding," James warned.

item.title: Trump walks out of news conference after reporter asks him about Veterans Choice lie he's told more than 150 times
item.description: President Donald Trump abruptly ended a Saturday news conference after a reporter challenged him on a lie about veterans health care he has told more than 150 times.

item.title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers kids' Covid-19 questions
item.description: CNN Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers children's coronavirus questions sent from around the country.

item.title: Juventus replaces sacked Maurizio Sarri with former star Andrea Pirlo
item.description: Juventus coach Maurizio Sarri was sacked on Saturday following the Serie A club's Champions League last 16 exit to Lyon.

item.title: When an elephant lost her leg, he invented a prosthesis for her
item.description: When Mosha, an elephant, was two years old, she lost her leg in a landmine injury along the Thai-Burmese border. Luckily, an orthopedic surgeon was able to fit her with the first prosthetic leg ever designed for an elephant. As she has grown, she has needed to be fitted for new ones. But she's never forgotten the doctor who changed her life.

item.title: South Korean lawmaker's dress sparks feminist debate
item.description: A barrage of online abuse directed at a South Korean lawmaker over her choice of attire has sparked a debate in the East Asian nation, where women have long complained about sexism and a patriarchal culture.

item.title: Anderson Cooper and Leslie Jordan look at actor's baby photos
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper asks actor Leslie Jordan about his baby photos that he's been posting online during quarantine. Watch Full Circle every Monday, Tuesday, and Friday at 6pm ET.

item.title: He's been stung 1,000 times -- for science
item.description: Justin Schmidt is in the business of pain.

item.title: Wendy's is eating McDonald's breakfast
item.description: On March 2, Wendy's finally launched its highly anticipated breakfast menu nationwide. Then, two weeks later, the morning commute basically collapsed because of lockdown measures encouraging people to work from home.

item.title: Actress Alyssa Milano: I don't know what to do in Covid-19 recovery
item.description: Alyssa Milano says she tested positive for coronavirus antibodies after having tested negative for Covid-19. The actress and activist joined CNN's Chris Cuomo to discuss her experience with infectious disease expert Dr. William Schaffner.

item.title: The measures include $400 a week in enhanced unemployment benefits, as the US economy struggles due to coronavirus outbreak
item.description: President Donald Trump will sign executive orders on Saturday after stimulus discussions broke down this week on Capitol Hill, two senior White House officials told CNN.

item.title: Trump makes multiple false claims about Covid-19 relief as he signs executive actions
item.description: President Donald Trump made multiple egregious false claims about Democrats during a Saturday "news conference" at his New Jersey golf club where he signed a series of pandemic-related executive actions.

item.title: Can the common cold help protect against coronavirus?
item.description: Preventive medicine specialist Dr. David Katz discusses an article in the journal Nature Reviews Immunology that suggests some immune systems are resistant to COVID-19.

item.title: Trump sets a dangerous precedent for democracy
item.description: President Donald Trump's ongoing battle with TikTok is becoming one of the most curious chapters in America's emerging cold war with China. Earlier this week, Trump issued an executive order which gave the Chinese social media giant until the middle of September to find an American buyer or be banned in the country. He also issued a similar executive order for the Chinese messaging service WeChat.

item.title: History professor who has accurately predicted every US presidential election since 1984 reveals 2020 pick
item.description: History professor Allan Lichtman is used to being right.

item.title: 'I don't know. Who knows?': Chinese golfer baffled by question about Trump
item.description: Chinese golfer Haotong Li hopes to write his own unique piece of history this weekend in San Francisco. But he's also finding it's the letters on his cap that are prompting questions about US President Donald Trump.
